#Text=Decide Between Religion and Atheism
#Text=Beliefs and spirituality are an important part of our lives .
#Text=Not only to get answers to spiritual questions , but also to identify in a group , to not feel rejected .
#Text=How to decide when you do n't know your own beliefs ?
#Text=Steps
#Text=Understanding the Difference Between Religion and Atheism
#Text=Know the definitions .
#Text=Most of the time , we look for answers without even understanding the question .
#Text=What does it mean to be religious ?
#Text=To be an atheist ?
#Text=You will notice that the definitions of these words are n't as clear as they may seem , and everybody has their own opinion on what they actually mean .
#Text=Clearly understanding the meanings of these words will help you understand exactly what you are looking for .
#Text=Religion : 1 .
#Text=The belief in and worship of a superhuman controlling power , especially a personal God or gods . 2 .
#Text=A particular system of faith and worship . 3 .
#Text=A pursuit or interest to which someone gives supreme importance .
#Text=Religious : Relating to or believing in a religion .
#Text=Atheism : 1 .
#Text=Disbelief or lack of belief in the existence of God or gods . 2 .
#Text=Skepticism , being unsure about whether or not a god or gods exist .
#Text=Atheist : 1 .
#Text=A person who disbelieves or lacks belief in the existence of God or gods . 2 .
#Text=A person who has no spiritual beliefs .
#Text=Learn about your subjects .
#Text=Knowing is good , but learning by yourself is better .
#Text=Do research on atheism , on the religion that interests you , get the definitions clear in your mind .
#Text=Understand what it means to choose a religion , to choose to be atheist , or even to create your own beliefs .
#Text=Because a religion is made to understand things we ca n't explain better , and if you have your own beliefs , you do n't have to pick a religion .
#Text=The research will also help you see all the sides of the medal , so you do n't have prejudice and you can stay open-minded .
#Text=Note your impressions .
#Text=Get a notebook and write everything about religions that interest you , about being an atheist , about anything you need .
#Text=That way , you will stay organized .
#Text=Learning Your Own Beliefs
#Text=Do it logically .
#Text=Make a list of pros and cons for each religion ( including atheism ) in your notebook .
#Text=Write as many arguments as you can .
#Text=Try to see if one religion comes out more frequently , has more pros or more cons , or has more interesting pros or cons .
#Text=You can also compare them with categories , such as holidays , restrictions , general beliefs , etc.
#Text=You can also ask your family and friends what they think , and see if they come up with pros or cons you did n't think of .
#Text=Basically , try to get a visual representation of what happens in your mind to help you get your ideas clear .
#Text=Do it spiritually .
#Text=Do meditation before going to bed , and think about your most profound beliefs .
#Text=Let your heart guide you .
#Text=Check out videos on YouTube on how to meditate .
#Text=Plus , if you do it before going to sleep , your subconscious will work on it during the night and you will have clearer ideas in the morning .
#Text=The basic concept here is to see where your mind tells you to go , to follow your guts and to be open-minded .
#Text=Try it out !
#Text=If one religion comes out more , always pops up in your mind , or you have any feeling this could be what you want , try adopting the religion for a year .
#Text=If you think this is how you want to live , if you think this is what you believe in , then good job !
#Text=You have made your choice .
#Text=If not , try again from the beginning .
#Text=Maybe you would prefer a religion that you did n't yet think of , or maybe you prefer not knowing and simply following the flow of life , seeing where it will lead you .
#Text=In the end , it all comes to you .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Always remember that you can switch if you do n't like the religion you chose .
#Text=Talk to people of the religions that interest you .
#Text=Nothing is better than talking to someone who lived it to tell you more about that religion !
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never base your decisions on what others may think of you .
#Text=Never base your decisions on prejudice .
#Text=Not being open-minded will hide great opportunities from you .
#Text=Base your decisions mostly on beliefs .
#Text=If you love your religion but do n't believe in the god of that religion , you should quit and search for what you really believe in .
